posts.post_content:
Just some thoughts here...  
  
!![Auramancer's Guise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Auramancer's Guise)!!  
  
[Infiltrator's Magemark](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Infiltrator's Magemark)  
[Guardian's Magemark](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Guardian's Magemark)  
[Celestial Ancient](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Celestial Ancient)  
[Eel Umbra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eel Umbra)  
[Hyena Umbra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hyena Umbra)  
[Divine Favor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Divine Favor)  
[Spirit Mantle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spirit Mantle)  
[Luminous Wake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Luminous Wake)  
[Aura Finesse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aura Finesse)  
  
And that's just off the top of my head. Among those you have life gain when she attacks, unblockable, protection from creatures, psuedo-indesctrucibility, First Strike, and the Magemarks provide their benefits to ALL enchanted creatures so they are useful if you are building around her abilities. Divine Favor even grants a small life gain whenever it ENTERS THE BATTLEFIELD, not just when cast. Aura Finesse cantrips and lets you scoot enchantments between critters if necessary so you don't have to feel shy about not getting full mileage the Magemark's if you are using them.  
  
I really like encha... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Divine Favor even grants a small life gain whenever it ENTERS THE BATTLEFIELD, not just when cast. posts.post_content: It's comical how bad she is in draft compared to the other two of the cycle. Sigarda is almost impossible to kill, and if Gisela survives to attack, the game is basically wrapped up... but Bruna? You've got what amounts to a 5/5 flier. For 6 mana. In two colors. I know she's good in EDH and other formats, but I'm glad I've only pulled Gisela and Sigarda in limited environments, because in that respect, this card actually makes me chuckle.
posts.html:

I know she's good in EDH and other formats, but I'm glad I've only pulled Gisela and Sigarda in limited environments, because in that respect, this card actually makes me chuckle.

Posted By: BilliamQ (6/29/2012 5:11:13 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I don't think she should be compared to Uril for some reasons, even though they seem to be similar in many ways, playstyles of their decks is different.   
  
Bruna's deck is in control colors, while Uril's deck is going to follow more of a beatdown strategy. The main idea is same - pump your command to extreme levels and annihilate your opponent with unstoppable force.   
  
Uril is hexproofed, and has "better" selection of auras for pure beatdown, and is powered up by stacking auras on him. With few small auras, you can get considerable beater, but he lacks evasion. It's not so hard to provide him some ways of evasion, though. He suffers from enchantment hate greatly, and can do little about it.   
  
Bruna, on the other hand, has build-in evasion in form of flying. You need to protect her before she can act, but it's not so hard in her colors. Blue provides you with shroud, white with protection of chosen color. Once you can attack with her, she is awesome. She does not provide you with brute... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

Uril is hexproofed, and has "better" selection of auras for pure beatdown, and is powered up by stacking auras on him. With few small auras, you can get considerable beater, but he lacks evasion. It's not so hard to provide him some ways of evasion, though. He suffers from enchantment hate greatly, and can do little about it.

Bruna, on the other hand, has build-in evasion in form of flying. You need to protect her before she can act, but it's not so hard in her colors. Posted By: SailorMoon (9/30/2012 8:17:30 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
"...you've got HOW many [Celestial Mantle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Celestial Mantle)s in your hand?"  
  
Side note: The blue colouring is excellent for Bruna because it lets you mill yourself to try and dump Auras (and [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites) to boot) into your graveyard, plus you can use [Deranged Assistant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deranged Assistant) to ramp into her. Just remember to pack some hexproof or it'll end up being a gigantic waste of time.
posts.html:
"...you've got HOW many Celestial Mantles in your hand?"

Side note: The blue colouring is excellent for Bruna because it lets you mill yourself to try and dump Auras (and Unburial Rites to boot) into your graveyard, plus you can use Deranged Assistant to ramp into her. Just remember to pack some hexproof or it'll end up being a gigantic waste of time.

Posted By: LordRandomness (9/27/2012 5:35:03 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This angel would be the death of my [Rafiq of the Many](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rafiq of the Many) deck; I'd be unable to use my own [Sovereigns of Lost Alara](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sovereigns of Lost Alara) trigger because she will just steal my [Eldrazi Con\*\*\*ion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eldrazi Con***ion) for herself.  
  
Good auras for her are probably obvious; if it protects her and grants her evasion like [Protective Bubble](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Protective Bubble), you want it. I'd also throw in totem armor auras and [Umbra Mystic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Umbra Mystic) to protect her from [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God) effects, and run [Winds of Rath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Winds of Rath) as your own Wrath effect.
posts.html:
This angel would be the death of my Rafiq of the Many deck; I'd be unable to use my own Sovereigns of Lost Alara trigger because she will just steal my Eldrazi Con***ion for herself.

Good auras for her are probably obvious; if it protects her and grants her evasion like Protective Bubble, you want it. I'd also throw in totem armor auras and Umbra Mystic to protect her from Wrath of God effects, and run Winds of Rath as your own Wrath effect.
